body: LEAD: A 9-year-old boy and a woman were killed and another boy and a woman were critically injured in Brooklyn late yesterday afternoon in a freak automobile accident in which the driver who caused it fled the scene, the police reported last night. title: 2 Pedestrians Killed, 2 Hurt in Freak Crash

body: LEAD: An 80-year-old woman died yesterday in a fire in a two-story home in Brooklyn, a Fire Department spokesman said. The woman, Teresa Palumbo, was found on the first floor of the house at 1413 36th Street, in the Borough Park section, said the spokesman, John Mulligan. She was declared dead at the scene after firefighters responded to the blaze
title: Elderly Woman Dies in Fire

body: LEAD: When Norman Steisel became New York City's Sanitation Commissioner in 1978, he inherited a department in chaos. Half the equipment was out of service, the work force was demoralized, there were no long-range plans to cope with a looming garbage crisis, and city streets from Riverdale to Far Rockaway were filthy. title: Man in the News; A SAVVY AND EFFICIENT MANAGER

title: Free-for-All Mayoral Encounter Displays Rivals' Temperaments

body: LEAD: A 15-month-old Brooklyn boy died last night from injuries suffered when his father backed over him with the family car, the police said. The child, Joseph Mandel, was apparently playing in the driveway of his home at 736 East Third Street in the Borough Park section. His father, Samson, did not see him as he was backing his 1977 Pontiac
title: Child Is Killed in Car Accident

title: Pierce Helped His Old Law Firm On H.U.D. Requests, Files Show

title: POSTINGS: A Time to Invest; East Meets West

body: LEAD: For Richard Ravitch, the race for mayor of New York City consists largely of shaking hands - hundreds and hundreds of hands. body: LEAD: Slowly but surely, Rudolph W. Giuliani the prosecutor is giving way to Rudolph W. Giuliani the mayoral candidate. The stern, sober United States Attorney who once gravely announced arrests and indictments now finds himself smiling a lot, shaking hands, patting backs and making small talk with little children. title: Giuliani Sheds Frown for Candidate's Smile
